intro: Hieracium melanochrotum, commonly known as the dark-chested hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its flowers are yellow, with a dark center, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium melanochrotum is often found in temperate regions and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with well-drained soil.
